intro: Trevoria zahlbruckneriana, commonly known as the Zahnbruckner's trevoria, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a sought-after specimen among horticulturists. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered endangered in its native range.
